title: Joe Bock (American football)
text:
Joseph Alan Bock (born July 21, 1959 in <a href="Rochester%2C%20New%20York">Rochester, New York</a>, USA) is a former American professional <a href="American%20football">football</a> player.
He attended <a href="East%20Rochester%20Junior-Senior%20High%20School">East Rochester High School</a> and played college football at the <a href="University%20of%20Virginia">University of Virginia</a> from 1977 to 1981. He was a defensive lineman and long snapper. His nickname is William.
Professional football career.
Joseph Alan Bock's professional career was from 1981–1988 and Joe also played in 2006 for the <a href="Rochester%20Raiders">Rochester Raiders</a> and the <a href="New%20York/New%20Jersey%20Revolution">New York/New Jersey Revolution</a> of the <a href="Great%20Lakes%20Indoor%20Football%20League">Great Lakes Indoor Football League</a> at the age of 46. Joe played for the <a href="Buffalo%20Bills">Buffalo Bills</a> in 1981 and 1987, the <a href="Birmingham%20Stallions">Birmingham Stallions</a> of the <a href="USFL">USFL</a> in 1983 and 1985, the <a href="Houston%20Gamblers">Houston Gamblers</a> in 1984, and the <a href="St.%20Louis%20Cardinals">St. Louis Cardinals</a> in 1987. In 1988, Joseph Alan Bock played in the <a href="Arena%20Football%20League%20%281987%E2%80%932008%29">Arena Football League</a> for the <a href="Chicago%20Bruisers">Chicago Bruisers</a> and appeared in <a href="ArenaBowl%20II">ArenaBowl II</a>.
